intro: Quararibea gigantiflora, commonly known as the giant-flowered quina, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 centimeters in diameter. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a slightly hairy texture. Quararibea gigantiflora is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests.
